text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Militant youths of feuding communities in midwestern oil-producing town of Warri attack an oil company services boat, kidnap the Nigerian captain and loot equipment worth several millions of naira.
- Interior minister Baba Gana Kingibe says a comprehensive improvement programme has been planned for the country's prisons to conform with international standards.

- Nigeria's military government begins a review of all existing laws which contains restrictions or inhibit investment and competition in key sectors of the economy, paper says, quoting own investigation.
